Source code for pydexpi.pid_development.rule_manager

from abc import ABC, abstractmethod

from networkx import DiGraph

from pydexpi.dexpi_classes import equipment, instrumentation, piping




[docs]
class Rule(ABC):
    """Abstract class for Rule implementation."""



[docs]
    @abstractmethod
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        pass








[docs]
class RuleManager:
    """Class to manage the rules for autocorrection of P&IDs.

    Attributes
    ----------
        rules (list): List of rules that the manager should apply.

    Methods
    -------
        add_rule: add a rule to be applied. Here, the order in which the rules
            are added matters.
        apply_rules: Apply all added rules to the given graph.

    ## Example usage:

    ## Create an initial graph
    initial_graph = nx.Graph()
    initial_graph.add_node("A")

    ## Initialize the chemical process graph with the initial graph
    chemical_graph = Graph_Loader(plant_graph=initial_graph)

    ## Manage and apply rules
    rule_manager = RuleManager()
    rule_manager.add_rule(ReactorTIRule())
    rule_manager.add_rule(PsvInletRule())

    ## Apply the rules to the graph in the defined order
    rule_manager.apply_rules(chemical_graph)

    ## Print the resulting graph
    print(chemical_graph)
    """

    def __init__(self):
        self.rules = []



[docs]
    def add_rule(self, rule: Rule):
        self.rules.append(rule)





[docs]
    def apply_rules(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for rule in self.rules:
            rule.apply(graph)
        return graph








[docs]
class ReactorTIRule(Rule):
    """Install a temperature instrument for a reactor
    (see docs/rules/reactor-ti-rule.svg)
    -> Add a TI node for reactor node
    """



[docs]
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for node in graph.copy():
            try:
                if node.tagName[0] == "R":
                    pass
                else:
                    continue
            except (AttributeError, TypeError):
                continue
            if issubclass(node.__class__, equipment.Vessel):
                ti_missing = True
                for successor in graph.successors(node):
                    if (
                        successor.__class__
                        == instrumentation.MeasuringLineFunction
                    ):
                        for successor2 in graph.successors(successor):
                            if (
                                successor2.__class__
                                == instrumentation.ProcessInstrumentationFunction
                                and successor2.processInstrumentationFunctionCategory
                                == "T"
                                and successor2.processInstrumentationFunctions
                                == "I"
                            ):
                                ti_missing = False
                if ti_missing:
                    measuring_line_function = (
                        instrumentation.MeasuringLineFunction()
                    )
                    temperature_indicator = (
                        instrumentation.ProcessInstrumentationFunction(
                            processInstrumentationFunctionCategory="T",
                            processInstrumentationFunctions="I",
                        )
                    )
                    graph.add_nodes_from(
                        [measuring_line_function, temperature_indicator]
                    )
                    graph.add_edges_from(
                        [
                            (node, measuring_line_function),
                            (measuring_line_function, temperature_indicator),
                        ]
                    )
                    print("Rule 17 is applied")








[docs]
class PsvInletRule(Rule):
    """Do not connect process pipes to a safety valve inlet pipe
    (see docs/rules/psv-inlet-rule.svg)
    -> Remove Tee node, the predecessor of PSV
    """



[docs]
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for node in graph.copy():
            if issubclass(node.__class__, piping.SafetyValveOrFitting):
                try:
                    prepredecessor = list(
                        graph.predecessors(list(graph.predecessors(node))[0])
                    )[0]
                except IndexError:
                    continue
                if issubclass(prepredecessor.__class__, piping.PipeTee):
                    for teePredecessor in graph.predecessors(prepredecessor):
                        for teePrepredecessor in graph.predecessors(
                            teePredecessor
                        ):
                            if issubclass(
                                teePrepredecessor.__class__, equipment.Vessel
                            ):
                                graph.add_edge(
                                    teePredecessor, node
                                )  # directly connect vessel to PSV
                                graph.remove_nodes_from(
                                    [
                                        prepredecessor,
                                        list(graph.predecessors(node))[0],
                                    ]
                                )  # remove pipeTee and spare pipe
                    print("Rule 22 is applied")








[docs]
class AddPsvRule(Rule):
    """Install safety valves for all tanks of pressure greater than 3 psig
    (see docs/rules/add-psv-rule.svg)
    -> Add a PSV node to container with the design pressure above 3psig
    """



[docs]
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for node in graph.copy():
            if issubclass(node.__class__, equipment.Vessel):
                for chamber in node.chambers:
                    if (
                        chamber.upperLimitDesignPressure.unit == "bar"
                        and chamber.upperLimitDesignPressure.value >= 0.207
                    ) or (
                        chamber.upperLimitDesignPressure.unit == "lbf/in2"
                        and chamber.upperLimitDesignPressure.value >= 3
                    ):
                        add_psv = True
                        for successor in graph.successors(node):
                            for successor2 in graph.successors(successor):
                                if issubclass(
                                    successor2.__class__,
                                    piping.SafetyValveOrFitting,
                                ):
                                    add_psv = False
                        if add_psv:
                            pipe = piping.Pipe()
                            psv = piping.SafetyValveOrFitting()
                            graph.add_nodes_from([pipe, psv])
                            graph.add_edges_from(
                                [
                                    (node, pipe),
                                    (pipe, psv),
                                ]
                            )








[docs]
class CvPositionRule(Rule):
    """Do not install a control valve before a pump, add it after the pump
    (see docs/rules/cv-position-rule.svg)
    -> Remove a CV node before the pump and add after the pump if there is no CV after the pump
    """



[docs]
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for node in graph.copy():
            if issubclass(node.__class__, piping.OperatedValve):
                try:
                    successor2 = list(
                        graph.successors(list(graph.successors(node))[0])
                    )[0]
                except IndexError:
                    continue
                if issubclass(successor2.__class__, equipment.Pump):
                    pre_cv = list(graph.predecessors(node))[0]
                    suc_pump = list(graph.successors(successor2))[0]
                    graph.add_edge(pre_cv, successor2)
                    graph.remove_node(list(graph.successors(node))[0])
                    graph.remove_edges_from(
                        [(successor2, suc_pump), (pre_cv, node)]
                    )
                    pipe = piping.Pipe()
                    graph.add_node(pipe)
                    graph.add_edges_from(
                        [(successor2, pipe), (pipe, node), (node, suc_pump)]
                    )
                    print("Rule 11 is applied")








[docs]
class CheckValveRule(Rule):
    """Install a check valve on a pump's discharge part
    (see docs/rules/check-valve-rule.svg)
    -> Add a check valve node after the pump
    """



[docs]
    def apply(self, graph: DiGraph):
        for node in graph.copy():
            if issubclass(node.__class__, equipment.Pump):
                try:
                    successor2 = list(
                        graph.successors(list(graph.successors(node))[0])
                    )[0]
                except IndexError:
                    continue
                if not issubclass(successor2.__class__, piping.CheckValve):
                    check_valve = piping.CheckValve()
                    graph.add_node(check_valve)
                    pipe = piping.Pipe()
                    graph.add_node(pipe)
                    pump_suc = list(graph.successors(node))[0]
                    graph.remove_edge(node, pump_suc)
                    graph.add_edges_from(
                        [
                            (node, pipe),
                            (pipe, check_valve),
                            (check_valve, pump_suc),
                        ]
                    )
                    print("Rule 6 is applied")
